titleStmt.title: George W. Anderson vs. King County. Application for Habeas Corpus.

bibl.title: George W. Anderson vs. King County. Application for Habeas Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Taken by force, and unlawfully without the jurisdiction of this court and without the Territory of Washington.

Whenfore your petition pray that a writ of habeas corpus may be granted. Directed to the said JC Mitchell + John H McGraw commanding him to have the body of your petitioner before your honor at a time and place therin to be apealead to do and recieve what shall then and there be considered by your honor concerning. Together with the time and cause of your petitioners detention, and said writ, and that he may be returned to his liberty George W Anderson

Territory of Washington County of King ss: George W. Anderson, being first duly herrin, according to law, when his oath deposes and says: that he is the petitioner named in the foregiven petition, that he has said the same. Knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be true. George W. Anderson
Sworn and subscribed before me this 1st Day of October A.D. 1889, Thomas R. Hardin Notary Public in and for King County Washington Territory.
